story.storybody:
Shahid Kapoor will next be seen in Abhishek Chaubey's Udta Punjab and is playing the role of Tommy Singh - a rockstar who is a drug-addict. The Haider actor and wife Mira Rajput went for the special screening of Udta Punjab and Mira was scared to see this side of her husband.

ALSO READ: Udta Punjab - Shahid Kapoor to skip promotions for Mira Rajput?

When asked how Mira reacted after watching Udta Punjab, the 35-year-old revealed that she was sitting two inches away from him during the film's screening. The Rangoon actor told Pinkvilla, "She was sitting two inches away from me (during the film's screening) and when the interval happened she was sitting two feet away from me. (laughs) Then she said please tell me you are not Tommy Singh."

Earlier, Shahid had himself said that it was a challenge for him to play the character of Tommy Singh. "It was definitely difficult playing a substance addict because I have never ever had alcohol in my life. I have never tried any drug. I have never had even half a bottle of beer. I was never interested in all these things and I have never supported it. I was one of those boring guys," Shahid earlier told IANS.

Shahid's film Udta Punjab deals with the issue of drug abuse in the state of Punjab. The film was also recently in news as it landed in trouble with the censor board. The Censor Board has demanded 40 cuts in the film. There were rumours that the film has been banned but producer Anurag Kashyap has clarified that the film is under the process for clearance and has not been banned.
